description: This interdisciplinary, topics-based course explores contemporary issues in science with emphasis on developing students' understanding of scientific and quantitiative approaches to problem solving. Specific topics, ranging from environmental chemistry and public health to biomechanics and genetics, vary from year to year. Students attend nine hours of lectures or small group discussion sections, two to three hours of quantitative workshops,and four hours of laboratory per week. The course is taught with WRIT 109. Offered annually during the summer. Does not count toward any major. Prerequisite: acceptance into the Summer Bridge Program.
name: Explorations in Science
notes: Open to SSS Summer Bridge students only.
prerequisites: acceptance into the Summer Bridge Program.
